events.title: First Human Spaceflight by Yuri Gagarin
events.description: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin became the first human to travel into space and orbit the Earth aboard Vostok 1.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of human space exploration and intensified the Space Race during the Cold War.

events.title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt Dies
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, died while in office. Vice President Harry S. Truman succeeded him.
events.significance: Roosevelt's death marked the end of an era during World War II and led to leadership changes affecting post-war policies.

events.title: Apollo 13 Mission Launch
events.description: Apollo 13 launched from Kennedy Space Center, intended to be the third crewed Moon landing mission, but it was aborted after an oxygen tank exploded en route.
events.significance: Demonstrated NASA's ability to manage critical in-flight emergencies and safely return astronauts to Earth.

events.title: First Mass Vaccination Using Polio Vaccine
events.description: The first mass vaccination campaign using Jonas Salk's polio vaccine began in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
events.significance: Pivotal moment in the fight against polio, leading to drastic reductions in cases worldwide.

events.title: Michelangelo Completes the Sistine Chapel Ceiling
events.description: Michelangelo finished painting the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City after about four years of work.
events.significance: Regarded as one of the greatest achievements of Renaissance art and a masterpiece of human creativity.
